document_data.name: Stirrup
document_data.mainbody: irrups typically consisted of leather straps that were attached to each side of a saddle by a hook and several ties. These straps ended in a metal foot rest, either in the form of a ring or a pointed cup.

document_data.Usage:
[[File:Spellplague FRCG.jpg|thumb|260px|''[[Thunderstorm]] shows off the proper usage of a stirrup.'']]
A stirrup was controlled with the foot. For example, [[Benelaius]] speculated that [[Kendra]]'s big feet helped her hold her stirrups well and ride better.<ref>

If a rider fell from the saddle, they risked getting their foot caught in a stirrup and being dragged on the ground or even beneath their mount, so they would try to free their foot when they fell.<ref>
document_data.Availability:
* In [[Athkatla]], one could find stirrups for sale at the market [[Waukeen's Promenade]].<ref><ref group="note" name="Duty">''[[For Duty & Deity]]'' states that every nonmagical item featured in the ''[[Arms and Equipment Guide]]'' can be purchased at Waukeen's Promenade.
* In the hamlet of [[Longsaddle]], [[Nalathar's Fine Stirrups & Spurs]] provided customers high-quality stirrups of a plain design for a single [[silver piece]] each.
* In [[Zhentil Keep]], one could find stirrups for sale at [[Lita's Equipment]].<ref><ref group="note" name="Lita">''[[Ruins of Zhentil Keep]]'' states that everything from the ''Arms and Equipment Guide'', except for arms and armor, can be purchased at Lita's Equipment.
document_data.History:
Stirrups were not invented on [[Toril]] until after the fall of the [[Netherese Empire]]. The eventual introduction of the stirrup allowed the [[polearm]]s known as [[lance]]s to become prevalent weaponry for those on mounts. It was considered nearly impossible for a mounted fighter to charge effectively with a leveled lance without them.

The eventual introduction of both the saddle and stirrup in the land of [[Zakhara]] caused the vehicles known as [[chariot]]s to gradually fall out of widespread use.

Notable Users of Stirrups.Businesses: * [[Norge Greenback's Horses]] kept a lot of stirrups in storage for handling their horses.<ref>{{Cite polyhedron/103/The Living City: The Horse Businesses|15}}
Notable Users of Stirrups.Regions & Settlements:
* Stirrups were utilized by horseman in the [[Hordelands]].
* Stirrups were utilized in the land of Zakhara.

document_data.Trivia: The war god [[Tempus]] was said to most often, prior to battles, manifest as a warrior riding with a foot in the stirrup of two separate horses. Symbolizing the chaotic nature of warfare.
